message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <obj>, Only PICK if gripper is empty. PICK only the correct next item according to the recipe.
2) PUT <obj1> <obj2>. <obj1> can be one of the foods. <obj2> can be food, cutting_board, or table.
3) WAIT, do nothing.
Only one robot can PUT each round. You must PICK up an item before PUT. 
[Action Output Instruction]
Must first output 'EXECUTE
', then give exactly one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example#1: 'EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
NAME Dave ACTION PICK tomato
'
Example#2: 'EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese tomato
'

[History]
== Round#0 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
I will PICK tomato2 since it's the next item in the recipe that is on my side of the table. Dave should WAIT because only one robot can PUT at a time and I need to place the tomato2 on the bread_slice1 which is not yet on the cutting_board.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Chad, you should PICK bread_slice1 instead, as it is the first item in the recipe and needs to be PUT on the cutting_board before we can add any other ingredients. After you PICK and PUT bread_slice1, I can proceed with the next steps.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
Understood, Dave. I will PICK bread_slice1 as it is indeed the first item that needs to be placed on the cutting_board. Once I have done that, you can continue with the next steps.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK bread_slice1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Chad]:
It seems there was a misunderstanding. I cannot reach bread_slice1 as it is not on my side of the table. I will PICK tomato2, which is the next item in the recipe that is on my side and can be placed on the bread_slice1 once it's on the cutting_board.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK tomato2
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK tomato2
Dave: WAIT
== Round#1 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, since I am currently holding tomato2, I will PUT it on the bread_slice1 once you have placed it on the cutting_board. Please PICK bread_slice1 and PUT it on the cutting_board so I can proceed with the next step.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice1
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PICK bread_slice1
Chad: WAIT
== Round#2 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, now that you have PICKed bread_slice1, you need to PUT it on the cutting_board. After that, I will be able to PUT tomato2 on the bread_slice1.

EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
Chad: WAIT
== Round#3 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT tomato2 bread_slice1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
Chad, you are correct. Once you PUT tomato2 on bread_slice1, I will PICK cheese, which is the next ingredient in the recipe.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT tomato2 bread_slice1
NAME Dave ACTION PICK cheese
[Executed Action]
Chad: PUT tomato2 bread_slice1
Dave: PICK cheese
== Round#4 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has already PICKed cheese, which is the correct next item according to the recipe. My next step should be to PICK beef_patty2, as it is the next ingredient on my side that needs to be stacked on the sandwich.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty2
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese tomato2
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PUT cheese tomato2
Chad: WAIT
== Round#5 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has already PUT the cheese on top of the tomato2, which is on the bread_slice1 on the cutting_board. The next item in the recipe is beef_patty2, which is on my side of the table. I will PICK beef_patty2 and wait for Dave to PUT the cheese on the tomato2 before I can PUT the beef_patty2 on the cheese.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty2
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
Chad, you have already PICKed beef_patty2 in the previous round, so you should be ready to PUT it on the cheese. I will PICK ham, which is the next ingredient on my side of the table and the next item in the recipe after beef_patty2.

EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PICK ham
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty2 cheese
[Chad]:
Dave, I have not yet PICKed beef_patty2. I will PICK it now and wait for your next action.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty2
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK beef_patty2
Dave: WAIT
== Round#6 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, since I am currently holding beef_patty2, I will PUT it on the cheese. After that, you can proceed with PICKing cucumber1, which is the next ingredient in the recipe on my side of the table.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty2 cheese
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
Chad, you are correct. After you PUT beef_patty2 on the cheese, I will PICK ham, which is the next ingredient on my side of the table and the next item in the recipe.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty2 cheese
NAME Dave ACTION PICK ham
[Executed Action]
Chad: PUT beef_patty2 cheese
Dave: PICK ham
== Round#7 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has already PICKed ham, which is the correct next item according to the recipe. Since my gripper is empty and the next item in the recipe on my side is cucumber1, I will PICK cucumber1.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK cucumber1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT ham beef_patty2
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PUT ham beef_patty2
Chad: WAIT
== Round#8 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has already PUT ham on top of beef_patty2. The next item in the recipe on my side is cucumber1. I will PICK cucumber1 and wait for Dave's next action.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK cucumber1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
Chad, you should PUT cucumber1 on the ham before I proceed with the next step. I will wait for your action.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT cucumber1 ham
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK cucumber1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK cucumber1
Dave: WAIT
== Round#9 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT cucumber1 ham
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
Chad, you are correct to PUT cucumber1 on the ham. After that, I will PICK bacon, which is the next ingredient on my side of the table and the next item in the recipe.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT cucumber1 ham
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bacon
[Executed Action]
Chad: PUT cucumber1 ham
Dave: PICK bacon
== Round#10 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has PICKed bacon, which is the correct next item according to the recipe. Since my gripper is empty, I will PICK beef_patty1, which is the next ingredient on my side that needs to be stacked on the sandwich.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
Chad, you are correct to PICK beef_patty1. I will PUT bacon on the cucumber1, which is the next step in the recipe.

EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bacon cucumber1
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PUT bacon cucumber1
Chad: WAIT
== Round#11 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has PUT bacon on the cucumber1. Now, I will PUT beef_patty1 on the bacon as it is the next item in the recipe and it is on my side of the table.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice2
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Dave: PICK bread_slice2
Chad: WAIT
== Round#12 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave has PICKed bread_slice2, which is the correct next item according to the recipe. Since my gripper is empty, I will PUT beef_patty1 on the bacon as it is the next item in the recipe and it is on my side of the table.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Dave]:
PROCEED
[Chad]:
PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice2 beef_patty1
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Chad]:
Dave, there was an error because beef_patty1 was not yet on the cutting_board. I will PUT beef_patty1 on the bacon, and then you can PUT bread_slice2 on top of it to complete the sandwich.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK beef_patty1
Dave: WAIT
== Current Round ==


You are a robot Chad, collaborating with Dave to make a [big_sandwich].
Food items must be stacked following this order: bread_slice1, tomato2, cheese, beef_patty2, ham, cucumber1, bacon, beef_patty1, bread_slice2, where bread_slice1 must be PUT on cutting_board. 
You must stay on right side of the table! This means you can only PICK food from right side, and Dave can only PICK from the other side.
Only one robot can PUT at a time, so you must coordiate with Dave.

At the current round:
You can see these food items are on your reachable side:
bread_slice1: on cutting_board
bacon: atop cucumber1
cheese: atop tomato2
ham: atop beef_patty2
cucumber2: on your side
beef_patty2: atop cheese
tomato2: atop bread_slice1
cucumber1: atop ham
Your gripper is holding beef_patty1
Think step-by-step about the task and Dave's response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said. Discuss with others to come up with the best plan.
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) output PROCEED, if the plans require further discussion; 2) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
You are Chad, your response is:

Dave has already PICKed bread_slice2, which is the correct final item according to the recipe. Since my gripper is holding beef_patty1, I will PUT beef_patty1 on the bacon as it is the next item in the recipe.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty1 bacon
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
